name: Lebanon
partner: Civic Initiative for Democratic and EuroAtlantic Choice (Civic IDEA)
takeaway: Lebanon demonstrates a notable level of military engagement with China, evidenced by imports of military equipment, participation in peacekeeping efforts, and joint military exercises. This cooperation extends to humanitarian aid, highlighting a multifaceted relationship beyond conventional defense ties.

Amidst Lebanon's economic challenges, its deepening relationship with China is evident through significant Chinese investments in infrastructure projects, bilateral agreements, active participation in the BRI through business alliances, and regulatory adjustments aimed at attracting more investments, all of which underscore Lebanon's strategic alignment with China's economic vision, despite debt dynamics.

Lebanese academic institutions have established significant partnerships with PRC-connected entities like Huawei, Tencent, and Alibaba, evident through various collaborations and agreements with universities for training programs and curriculum development. The establishment of Confucius Institutes promoting Chinese language and culture, and active participation in PRC talent recruitment programs, highlights important aspects of the academic cooperation between two countries.

The result suggests a notable presence and involvement of PRC-connected entities, particularly in the telecommunications sector of Lebanon. This includes providing telecom services, supplying hardware for cellular networks (4G/5G), and collaborating on the implementation of smart city systems. The partnerships and agreements between Lebanese companies and PRC entities underscore a growing technological influence from the PRC in Lebanon's infrastructure and digital landscape.

Lebanon's foreign policy toward the PRC is characterized by diverse interactions, including joint parliamentary committees, substantial aid receipts, Strategic Partnership documents, diplomatic training programs, explicit support for the "one China principle," and diplomatic alignment on key PRC policies and territorial issues.
description-1: In 2023, Lebanon had a GDP per capita of US$3,824 and a total population of 5.76 million people.
description-2: Lebanon established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1971. Lebanon was ranked 140th in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Partly Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 42/100.

https://english.almayadeen.net/articles/blog/lebanese-media:-an-arab-pioneer-on-media-silk-road
A deal was reached in 2016 between Lebanon TV and China's state television, whereby Lebanon was provided with certain equipment. National News Agency was given a large number of computers and training workshops by the Chinese government in order to facilitate mutual collaboration.
More seminars and training sessions for journalists and more equipment donations are expected from the Chinese government in Lebanon. Media in Lebanon will focus on Chinese matters, invite Chinese specialists and introduce the Lebanese people and Arabs to Chinese news. “Chinese channels were introduced on the Arab satellites Nilesat and Arabsat, such as CGTN Arabic and China Arab TV so that these stations broadcast Chinese programs translated into Arabic.
CGTN has created a special section for social communication run by Chinese employees specialized in the Arabic language and Arab employees, and the task of this section is to present events and news related to China in particular, and the world in general, on social media such as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and Wechat, which is also done by China Radio.”   https://english.almayadeen.net/articles/blog/lebanese-media:-an-arab-pioneer-on-media-silk-road
As part of its Belt and Road Initiative, China has recently displayed a keen interest in the Arab world. CGTN Arabic and China Arab TV, two Chinese TV stations, have been introduced to the Arab satellites Nilesat and Arabsat, which transmit documentaries and news about China and the Arab world. To keep up with all of CGTN Arabic and China International Radio's social media accounts (Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and Wechat), separate department staffed by Chinese and Arabs has been established.                               http://www.businessnews.com.lb/cms/Story/StoryDetails/4759/Chinese-TV-channel-launched
Silk Road TV, a channel dedicated to trade and cultural relations between the Arab world and China has begun airing a month-long pilot phase.
The Lebanese Chinese Business Council (LCBC) is the exclusive partner of the station locally and in the Arab world.
“Lebanon is at the heart of the trade activities with China; this is why we decided that it will host this station,” said Ali El Masri, Chairman of the board of LCBC.
Station programs include topics on trade activities, mutual business and investment opportunities, as well as other related information.                                               https://ara.yidaiyilu.gov.cn/

Foreign Policy.evidence:
http://geneva.china-mission.gov.cn/eng/dbdt/202106/t20210624_9103595.htm
Joint statement of 69 countries at the Interactive Dialogue on High Commissioner's annual report at the 47th session of the Human Rights Council: (2021-06-22)
Madam President,
I have the honor to deliver the statement on behalf of 69 countries.
Respect for sovereignty, independence and territorial integrity of states and non-interference in internal affairs of sovereign states represent basic norms governing international relations. Hong Kong, Xinjiang and Tibet related issues are China's internal affairs that brook no interference by any external forces. We support China's implementation of "one country, two systems" in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region. We call upon all states to uphold multilateralism, solidarity and collaboration, and to promote and protect human rights through constructive dialogue and cooperation. We oppose politicization of human rights and double standards. We also oppose unfounded allegations against China out of political motivation and based on disinformation, and interference in China's internal affairs under the pretext of human rights.
